newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA LEV CLOSES UNCHANGED AT 1,601-1,605 TO DLR.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA LEV CLOSES UNCHANGED AT 1,601-1,605 TO DLR.

text.p: The Bulgarian lev closed around 1,601-1,606 per dollar, in a narrower spread from the morning's 1,595-1,605 but softer from Monday's close at 1,595-1,600 after active interbank forex trade, dealers said.
"Trade was lively amid balance between dollar demand and supply. It was rangebound between 1,600-1,606 levs per dollar," one dealer said.
Dealers said they were aiming at higher dollar levels amid the current large spread between interest rates on lev- and dollar-denominated deposits.
The Bulgarian National Bank's main interest rate is now set at a monthly 18 percent or 216 percent per year.
Under the current exchange rate the spread between interest rates allows for an up to 10 lev per dollar daily depreciation.
But traders said they did not expect a daily lev fall due to a low foreign currency demand from final clients.
Due to high interest rates on lev-denominated investments banks are willing to sell dollars and channel funds to the higher-yielding lev instruments, traders said.
